title: 115_hr108
content: The Act titled "Student Loan Repayment Assistance Act of 2017" introduces a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, providing a Student Loan Repayment Program Credit. The "Student Loan Repayment Assistance Act of 2017" introduces a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, providing a 10% employer-provided student loan repayment credit for qualified student loan repayments up to $500 per month. This credit is applicable to a separate written plan of an employer for the exclusive benefit of employees to provide student loan payment assistance. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a 10% employer-provided student loan repayment credit for qualified student loan repayments up to $500 per month. The employer must have a separate written plan to provide student loan payment assistance, meeting specific requirements such as direct payment for employee education loans and non-discrimination in program availability. The employer must report the number of employees using the plan, the number eligible, and plan terms to the Secretary for the student loan repayment credit. Notification of program availability must be provided to all eligible employees. The credit is now part of the general business credit in the Internal Revenue Code. Notification of program availability must be provided to all eligible employees. The credit is now part of the general business credit in the Internal Revenue Code, with special rules for certain small employers. In applying paragraph (1) to credits, the tentative minimum tax is treated as zero. The limitation under paragraph (1) is reduced by the credit allowed for the taxable year. Credits exceeding the limitation under paragraph (1) are also addressed. The excess of the limitation under paragraph (1) is treated as a credit under subpart C for specified small businesses, defined as eligible small businesses with less than 100 full-time employees. The employer-provided student loan repayment credit is determined under section 45S(a) and is applicable to eligible small businesses with less than 100 full-time employees. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including inserting the employer-provided student loan repayment credit under section 45S(a). Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by this section, including the student loan repayment program credit under section 45S, will apply to taxable years after the enactment of this Act.
